page.title: 13Industry in Plympton
page.content: The industry in Plympton is concentrated into two main areas, namely the{Cot Hill}and{Newnham Industrial Estates. The Cot Hill site was originally part of the{Great Western Railway marshalling yards. The more recent additons to the Industrial Estate have been some buildings between the main railway line and Plymouth Road, on what was once scrub land. Most of the industry is commercial, including many "Do-it-Yourself" stores, Hypermarkets and garages. Three buildings are unoccupied at present, although one has been sold. Of the other two buildings, one is for sale, and the other is on lease. To the west end of Cot Hill there is a {Sewage Treatment Works }which serves the whole of the Plympton area.
